00032 // Methods for the class DAS - a class used to parse the dataset attribute
00033 // structure.
00034 //
00035 // jhrg 7/25/94

00104 DAS::DAS(AttrTable *attr, string name)
00105 {
00106     append_container(attr, www2id(name));
00107 }
00108 
00109 // The class DASVHMap knows that it contains pointers to things and correctly
00110 // makes copies of those things when its copy ctor is called, so DAS can do a
00111 // simple member-wise copy. Similarly, we don't need to define our own op=.
00112 
00113 // This deletes the pointers to AttrTables allocated during the parse (and at 
00114 // other times). jhrg 7/29/94
00115 
00116 DAS::~DAS()
00117 {
00118 }

00205 AttrTable *
00206 DAS::add_table(const string &name, AttrTable *at)
00207 {
00208     DBG(cerr << "Adding table: " << name << "(" << at << ")" << endl);
00209     return AttrTable::append_container(at, name);
00210 }

00216     return add_table((string)name, at);

00232 void
00233 DAS::parse(string fname)
00234 {
00235     FILE *in = fopen(fname.c_str(), "r");
00236 
00237     if (!in) {
00238       throw Error(can_not_read_file, "Could not open: " + fname);
00239     }
00240 
00241     parse(in);
00242 
00243     int res = fclose(in);
00244     if( res ) {
00245     DBG(cerr << "DAS::parse - Failed to close file " << (void *)in << endl ;) ;
00246     }
00247 }
00248 
00259 void
00260 DAS::parse(int fd)
00261 {
00262 #ifdef WIN32
00263     FILE *in = fdopen(_dup(fd), "r");
00264 #else
00265     FILE *in = fdopen(dup(fd), "r");
00266 #endif
00267 
00268     if (!in) {
00269     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "Could not access file.");
00270     }
00271 
00272     parse(in);
00273 
00274     int res = fclose(in);
00275     if( res ) {
00276     DBG(cerr << "DAS::parse(fd) - Failed to close " << (void *)in << endl ;) ;
00277     }
00278 }
00279 
00280     
00281 
00288 void
00289 DAS::parse(FILE *in)
00290 {
00291     if (!in) {
00292     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "Null input stream.");
00293     }
00294 
00295 #if 0
00296     dasrestart(in);
00297 #endif
00298     void *buffer = das_buffer(in);
00299     das_switch_to_buffer(buffer);
00300 
00301     parser_arg arg(this);
00302 
00303     bool status = dasparse((void *)&arg) == 0;
00304 
00305     das_delete_buffer(buffer);
00306 
00307     //  STATUS is the result of the parser function; if a recoverable error
00308     //  was found it will be true but arg.status() will be false.
00309     if (!status || !arg.status()) {// Check parse result
00310     if (arg.error())
00311       throw *arg.error();
00312     }
00313 }
00314 
00316 
00331 void
00332 DAS::print(ostream &os, bool dereference)
00333 {
00334     os << "Attributes {" << endl;
00335 
00336     AttrTable::print(os, "    ", dereference);
00337 
00338     os << "}" << endl;
00339 
00340 }
00341 
00354 void
00355 DAS::print(FILE *out, bool dereference)
00356 {
00357     fprintf( out, "Attributes {\n" ) ;
00358 
00359     AttrTable::print(out, "    ", dereference);
00360 
00361     fprintf( out, "}\n" ) ;
00362 }

00412 // redefine Pix to be an IteratorAdapter. Usage remains the same and all code
00413 // outside of the DAP should compile and link with no problems. Added methods

00415 // iterators. Replaced the use of Pix within the DAP to use iterators instead.

00417 // unit tests. Updated the Makefile to remove GNU/SLList and GNU/DLList.

00419 // Revision 1.32.4.5  2002/08/08 06:54:56  jimg
00420 // Changes for thread-safety. In many cases I found ugly places at the
00421 // tops of files while looking for globals, et c., and I fixed them up
00422 // (hopefully making them easier to read, ...). Only the files RCReader.cc
00423 // and usage.cc actually use pthreads synchronization functions. In other
00424 // cases I removed static objects where they were used for supposed
00425 // improvements in efficiency which had never actually been verifiied (and
00426 // which looked dubious).

00437 // Revision 1.32.4.4  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00438 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00439 // I added those where they were needed.
00440 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00441 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00442 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00443 // just good form when using delete.
00444 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00445 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00446 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00447 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00448 // characters on their own.

00473 // Revision 1.31  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00474 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00475 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00476 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00477 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00478 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00479 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
